decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun within 3 years from the date of this permission.
Reason: To accord with the provisions of paragraph AA.2 (3), of Part 20, Schedule 2 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended).

Condition : 2 - The proposed development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with the proposals contained in the application and the plans submitted (Transport Statement (2416/TS/02), Daylight and Sunlight Report (Neighbouring Properties), Daylight and Sunlight Report (Within Development), Building Character Assessment, Phase I Geo-Environmental Due Diligence Risk Assessment Reference 231101.DD.02, Planning Noise Assessment, Flood Risk Assessment: Received 26/04/2024. A_PL_PR_012 Rev P01, A_PL_PR_110 Rev P01, A_PL_PR_111 Rev P01, A_PL_PR_112 Rev P01, A_PL_PR_113 Rev P02, A_PL_PR_114 Rev P01, A_PL_PR_310 Rev P01, A_PL_PR_312 Rev P01, A_PL_EX_312 Rev P01, A_PL_EX_310 Rev P01, Highgate Transportation Technical Note June 2024, Highgate Transportation Technical Note July 2024: Received 25/06/2024. A_PL_PR_109 Rev P02, A_PL_PR_311 Rev P00, A_PL_PR_313 Rev P00, A_PL_EX_113 Rev P00, A_PL_EX_311 Rev P00, A_PL_EX_313 Rev P00: Received 01/08/2024) therewith and approved by the Local Planning Authority, or as shall have been otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the building is used.
Reason: To ensure the development is carried out in accordance with the agreed details.

Condition : 3 - The materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the development hereby permitted shall match those used in the existing building, unless otherwise shown on the approved plans.
Reason: In order to safeguard the appearance of the area.

Condition : 4 - Prior to first occupation of the dwellings, a noise mitigation scheme shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The scheme shall accord with the submitted Noise Assessment, and include details of all required noise mitigation measures, including details of the encasement of the circular steel columns and sealing of the gaps between the existing junction between the slab edge and spandrel section. Works shall be carried out as agreed prior to first occupation of the development and retained as such permanently thereafter. 

Reason: In the interest of future occupants' living conditions.

Condition : 5 - Before the development hereby permitted is first occupied or brought into use, a Car Parking Management Plan shall first be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The plan shall include details of how the remaining commercial car parking spaces within the site shall be made unavailable for the residential use. The development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the approved details and shall be maintained for the lifetime of the development.  
Reason: To control the level and usage of parking on the site and to support sustainable transport objectives.

Condition : 6 - The development shall not be occupied until arrangements have been agreed in writing with the local planning authority and put in place to ensure that, with the exception of disabled persons, no resident of the development shall obtain a resident's parking permit within any controlled parking zone which may be in force in the area at any time.
Reason: To protect the free flow and safety of traffic on nearby highways and to support sustainable transport objectives.

Condition : 7 - Notwithstanding the submitted details and prior to first occupation of the dwellings, full details (including manufacturer's specifications) of all cycle parking facilities for the occupants of, and visitors to including their access shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority, complying with the standards set out in the London Plan. The approved facilities shall conform to current guidance such as the TfL London Cycling Design Standards and West London Cycle Parking Guidance in design and layout and be fully implemented and be made available for use before the first occupation of the development and thereafter retained for use at all times without obstruction.
Reason: To support sustainable transport objectives.
description: Prior Approval Notification for the proposed erection of an upwards extension to create an additional floor to provide 10 self-contained flats
